column5: Gents,  Is there any way to make your own minnow traps?  Or are the aluminum ones that you buy better to use?  ...CementCarver
my uncle uses this one.. works pretty good!  http://www.ehow.com/how_4679769_homemade-minnow-trap.html
Thanks. Looks pretty easy to make. I'll give it a try.  ....CementCarver
Personally I would just spend the $10 and pick up the premade one at Canadian tire - lol but I'm lazy.

I too use that one , cheap and easy. You will refine it with some holes around the sides so it sinks faster , and some rocks in the bottom so it goes where you want. I just use white bread as bait and I have caught more than twentey  at a time in a  2 lr. bottle. And if someone takes it no loss just make another.
